pullRequest.body:
Proving that there is always an open normal subgroup in a clopen nhd of compact topological group

Co-authored-by: NailinGuan <3571819596@qq.com> Yi Song <sif4delta0@mail.ustc.edu.cn> Xuchun Li <li.xuchun@qq.com>


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0f2bc6c4a6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18377/commits/0f2bc6c4a6f6f8d9c6f2f9ac490d2b85547ad0b9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.ClopenNhdofOne`|1000|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ TopologicalAddGroup.addNegClosureNhd`
`+ TopologicalGroup.mulInvClosureNhd`
`+ exist_mul_closure_nhd`
`+ exist_openNormalSubgroup_sub_clopen_nhd_of_one`
`+ exist_openSubgroup_sub_clopen_nhd_of_one`
`+ exists_mulInvClosureNhd`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I don’t understand why you want to use definitions instead of lemmas stating existence, since what you construct is not a canonical object. Not only the result looks a bit strange, but you need to suffer with all those `Classical.choose` and `Classical.choose_spec` (by the way, you could use `Exists.choose` and `Exists.choose_spec` to get access to dot notation).

Why not finishing the main file with
```
@[to_additive]
lemma iUnion_pow {G : Type*} [Group G] {V : Set G} (einV : 1 ∈ V) :
    {x : G | ∃ n : ℕ, x ∈ V ^ n} = ⋃ n , V ^ (n + 1) := by
  …

@[to_additive "An open subgroup that is contained in a given clopen neighborhood of `1`."]
lemma OpenSubgroupSubClopenNhdsOfOne {G : Type*} [Group G] [TopologicalSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G]
    [CompactSpace G] {W : Set G} (WClopen : IsClopen W) (einW : 1 ∈ W) : 
    ∃ H : OpenSubgroup G, (H : Set G) ⊆ W := by
  rcases exists_mulInvClosureNhd WClopen with ⟨T, hT⟩
  let S : Subgroup G := {
    carrier := {x : G | ∃ n : ℕ, x ∈ T ^ n}
    mul_mem':= by
      rintro a b ⟨na, hna⟩ ⟨nb, hnb⟩
      use na + nb
      rw [pow_add]
      exact Set.mul_mem_mul hna hnb
    one_mem':= ⟨1, (by simp only [pow_one, mem_of_mem_nhds hT.nhd])⟩
    inv_mem':= by
      simp only [Set.mem_setOf_eq, forall_exists_index]
      intro x m hm
      use m
      rw [← hT.inv]
      simpa using hm }
  refine ⟨⟨S, ?_⟩, ?_⟩
  · simp only [iUnion_pow <| mem_of_mem_nhds hT.nhd]
    refine isOpen_iUnion (fun n ↦ ?_)
    rw [pow_succ]
    exact IsOpen.mul_left hT.isOpen
  · change {x : G | ∃ n : ℕ, x ∈ T ^ n} ⊆ W 
    simp_rw [iUnion_pow (mem_of_mem_nhds hT.nhd), Set.iUnion_subset_iff]
    intro n _
    have mulVpow: W * T ^ (n + 1) ⊆ W := by
      induction' n with n ih
      · simp only [zero_add, pow_one, hT.mul]
      · rw [pow_succ, ← mul_assoc]
        exact le_trans (Set.mul_subset_mul_right ih) <|
          hT.mul
    apply le_trans _ mulVpow
    intro x xin
    rw [Set.mem_mul]
    use 1, einW, x, xin
    rw [one_mul]

end TopologicalGroup
```
Note how manipulating `T` and `hT` is less painful than what you do in your version. 

By the way, if you really want to keep `iUnion_pow` then it should move to some algebra file since this has nothing to do with topology, and probably also get a more descriptive name.
The lemma `iUnion_pow` is no longer needed, thus removed, the defs and properties are now retated with lemma of existence.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11601071889/job/32302958899)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11601071889/job/32302959445)
We are almost done!
We are almost done!
Please update and improve formatting and grammar.
Why `letI` instead of `have`? This is a `Prop`, and inlining brings nothing here.
Sorry, what do you mean "inlining brings nothing here"?

Do you know the difference between `have` and `haveI`? It’s all about inlining (the letter `I` stands for inlining). So if you don’t know what inlining means then you should never use `haveI` or `letI`. See the explanations in [core Lean](https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/blob/ac80e261bd253e0d41de5027d5e8d25570b7f982/src/Init/Tactics.lean#L1125-L1129).

Note that, very confusingly, Lean 3 used to have tactics called `haveI` and `letI` that were completely unrelated to this (at that time the letter `I` stood for “instance”). So if you learned this in Lean 3, you simply need to forget about it. Those Lean 3 tactics are no longer needed in Lean 4.
Thank you, this should be changed into `have`

You can use generalized projections (aka dot notation) to condense all this, and also avoid explicit projection `H.1`. Something like
```
  rcases existOpenSubgroupSubClopenNhdsOfOne WClopen einW with ⟨H, hH⟩
  have : H.FiniteIndex := H.finiteIndex_of_finite_quotient
  use { toSubgroup := H.normalCore
        isOpen' := Subgroup.isOpen_of_isClosed_of_finiteIndex _ <|
          H.normalCore_isClosed <| H.isClosed }, fun _ b ↦ hH (H.normalCore_le b)
Please update and improve formatting.
Why do you keep the multiplicative name here and below in `mul`?
oops, I forgot to change it. Thank you
Those nested ⟨⟩ should not be necessary since ⟨⟩ is right-associative.
Same here.
Is there any reason to use `simp only` here? Is `simp [memW]` too slow?
I was once told not to leave amy `simp []` and use `simp only` instead because some stability between versions. So what is the convention we usually follow? Thank you
This is only for non-terminal simps, or slow ones. Please read https://leanprover-community.github.io/extras/simp.html.
Could you please use more descriptive names for those assumptions h1 to h5?
You can probably use dot notation here.
And also get rid of most pairs of ⟨⟩
Please use more descriptive names.
Again, why the `simp only`? This is a terminal `simp`, there is no need to clutter the tactic script, I would try `  · exact (h2.inter h2.inv).mem_nhds (by simp [h3])`
What about here? Does `simp` work?
It works, can be restated as `simp only [inter_mem_iff, IsOpen.mem_nhds h2 h3, inv_mem_nhds_one, and_self]`
dot notation?
What is `<|` doing here? There is no parsing ambiguity without it. And what about writing `exact (Set.mul_subset_mul_right ih).trans hV.mul` instead?
Please mention the compactness assumption.
Why do you want `haveI` here instead of `have`?
Why “proved” instead of “proves”?
Same remarks as in the previous file.

```suggestion
# Existence of an open normal subgroup in any clopen neighborhood of the neutral element

```
This names covers the additive case as well (and the new line is needed).
I forgot to say earlier: now that this became a lemma and not a definition, it should switch to the lemma naming convention. See https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html.

```suggestion
This file is split out from the file `OpenSubgroup` because it needs more imports.
```

```suggestion
## Existence of an open subgroup in any clopen neighborhood of the neutral element

```
This names covers the additive case as well (and the new line is needed).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Group): Open normal subgroup in clopen nhds of one

source.title: feat(Topology/Group): Open normal subgroup in clopen nhds
